events.description: Iron ore futures fell below CNY 770 a ton, hitting a seven-week low.
A seasonal period in China associated with weaker industrial demand.
Several blast furnaces and electric-arc furnaces paused operations for maintenance.

facts.fact_text: Iron ore futures fell below CNY 770 a ton.

evidences.evidence_text: Iron ore futures fell below CNY 770 a ton, hitting a seven-week low

facts.fact_text: Iron ore inventories at Chinese ports are near record highs.

evidences.evidence_text: iron ore inventories at Chinese ports are near record highs
industry data showed blast furnace utilization remained above 86%

facts.fact_text: Daily hot metal output rose by 21,000 tons week-on-week.

evidences.evidence_text: daily hot metal output rose by 21,000 tons week-on-week

facts.fact_text: Iron ore shipments from Australia and Brazil accelerated in late January.

evidences.evidence_text: iron ore shipments from Australia and Brazil accelerated in late January

claims.claim_text: Rising supply and seasonally weaker demand are driving the price drop.
claims.author: Analysts

evidences.evidence_text: rising supply coincided with seasonally weaker demand ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday

claims.claim_text: Maintenance pauses are raising concerns over near-term feedstock demand.

evidences.evidence_text: several blast furnaces and electric-arc furnaces have paused operations for planned maintenance, raising concerns over near-term feedstock demand

claims.claim_text: Accelerated shipments are adding pressure to near-term supply.

evidences.evidence_text: iron ore shipments from Australia and Brazil accelerated in late January, adding further pressure to near-term supply
